Parameter Injection

The Dinoloop team created a value injection framework which automatically parses the variable segments from the URI and injects them as action method parameters. This reduces boiler plate code. This is how it works, 


    

    

        ValueInjection framework uses
        path-to-regexp which is created by expressjs team and it is extensively used in expressjs for routing. Please
        go through their
        documentation on how to use variable-segments, optional-segments and etc. Following are the assumptions made
        by ValueInjection framework.
    

    
    
        
  • The Variable segment key should match with action method parameter.
    • 
        
  • Currently, all values are injected as
            string type. This is the limitation of variable segments itself.
    • 
    




Using @Parse in ParameterInjection (V2.x.x and above)



    
@Parse does the validation/transformation on the variable segments using IParseHandler (which is simply a mapper function).
        This reduces writing boilerplate code for validation and also seperates the concerns from controllers logic.
    

    

        

    

    
    
        
  • @Parse can also be used with http-body for model validation.
            Here is an example that explains it.
    • 
    




Using @QueryParam in ParameterInjection (V2.x.x and above)



    
@QueryParam does the validation/transformation on the
        query-string/query-params using IParseHandler (which is simply a mapper function). This reduces writing boilerplate
        code for validation and also seperates the concerns from controllers logic.
    

    

        

    

    
    
        
  • @QueryParam works only with query-string values.
    •

        IParseHandlers in detail
